scenario_name: Q3 Sprint 5 Planning – Mobile Payments Checkout Revamp
company_context: FinTechCo is a mid‑size financial‑technology firm (≈300 employees) that powers a consumer‑facing mobile payments app called FinPay. The Velocity Payments Squad (10 members) owns the end‑to‑end checkout experience for iOS, Android and web. The squad follows Scrum with a two‑week sprint cadence and a T‑14 planning horizon. This sprint (Sprint 5 of Q3 2025) focuses on tokenized card storage, Apple Pay integration, and a UI redesign to improve conversion rates.
meeting_event_details:
Date: 2025‑12‑02 (Tuesday)
Time: 10:00 AM – 11:30 AM EST (90 minutes)
Location: Zoom (Meeting ID: 842 123 4567, Passcode: sprint5)
Facilitator: Grace Liu (Scrum Master)
Agenda: Review backlog, commit to sprint goal, identify dependencies/blockers, finalize sprint backlog and capacity.
stakeholders: Aisha Patel – Product Manager (Sprint Owner, defines acceptance criteria)
Ravi Kumar – Lead Backend Engineer (API design & integration)
Lena Chen – Frontend Engineer (React Native UI implementation)
Miguel Torres – iOS Mobile Engineer (Swift, Apple Pay)
Sara O'Neill – Android Mobile Engineer (Kotlin, Google Pay fallback)
Jenna Lee – UX/UI Designer (Checkout redesign assets)
Tom Whitaker – QA Lead (Test planning & automation)
Ethan Brooks – DevOps Engineer (CI/CD pipeline updates)
Grace Liu – Scrum Master (Facilitates meeting, removes impediments)
Mark Daniels – Finance Director (Budget approval for third‑party token service)
deliverables: Story #1243 – Implement tokenized card storage service (backend + mobile SDK)
Story #1247 – Add Apple Pay support to checkout flow (iOS only)
Story #1250 – Redesign checkout UI (new wireframes, component library updates)
Story #1254 – Create automated regression test suite for payment flow (Cypress + Appium)
Story #1258 – Release candidate build to internal beta testers (via TestFlight & Google Play Internal Test)
Story #1262 – Update public API documentation for token service (Swagger + Confluence)
Sprint Goal – Reduce checkout latency by ≥30 % and achieve ≥95 % automated test coverage for new payment paths
success_criteria: Average checkout latency measured in production < 1.2 seconds (baseline 1.7 s).
Automated test coverage for new payment flows ≥ 95 % (unit + integration).
Zero critical (P1) bugs released to production; max 2 high‑severity bugs allowed for remediation within the sprint.
Beta‑tester satisfaction score ≥ 80 % on the new UI (survey of 30 internal users).
All committed story points delivered within 80 % of the team's velocity (target 48 pts, actual ≥ 38 pts).
constraints: Sprint length fixed at 2 weeks (Nov 30 – Dec 13 2025).
Budget cap of $45,000 for third‑party tokenization service and design assets (approved by Finance).
Dependency on Payments Platform Team to release API v2 (expected 2025‑12‑01).
Design assets must be finalized and handed off by 2025‑12‑03 to avoid UI implementation delay.
Security compliance review (PCI DSS 4.0) must be completed before production release; pending exception approval from Compliance (expected 2025‑12‑07).
Mobile support must remain compatible with iOS 15+ and Android 9+ devices.
workback_prompt: Create a detailed work‑back plan for FinTechCo's Velocity Payments Squad Sprint 5 (2025‑12‑02 planning meeting). The plan should break down each deliverable into weekly tasks, assign owners, list required approvals, identify critical path items (API v2 release, design hand‑off, PCI compliance review), and include milestones for testing, beta release, and production deployment. Include buffer time for unforeseen blockers and ensure the plan respects the $45k budget and PCI DSS 4.0 compliance requirements.
